briefingSummary: Today's AI news features a mix of significant research advancements and community discussions around AI tools and applications. Notably, the release of GLM-5 has sparked considerable interest on platforms like Hacker News and Reddit, highlighting ongoing developments in large language models and their applications.

topStory.title: GLM-5: From Vibe Coding to Agentic Engineering
topStory.summary: The Hacker News community is buzzing about GLM-5, which focuses on agentic engineering and complex systems, generating significant engagement.
topStory.analysis: The release of GLM-5 is a pivotal moment in the AI community, showcasing advancements in agentic engineering and complex systems. Its high engagement on Hacker News indicates strong interest and potential implications for future AI applications.

items.title: A Small-Scale System for Autoregressive Program Synthesis Enabling Controlled Experimentation
items.summary: This paper discusses a small-scale system for autoregressive program synthesis that enables controlled experimentation, focusing on the research potential of small models.

items.title: Uncertainty-Aware Multimodal Emotion Recognition through Dirichlet Parameterization
items.summary: The authors present a lightweight and privacy-preserving framework for multimodal emotion recognition, suitable for deployment on edge devices.

items.title: PABU: Progress-Aware Belief Update for Efficient LLM Agents
items.summary: This study proposes Progress-Aware Belief Update for efficient LLM agents, addressing the issue of redundant actions and inference costs in large language models.

items.title: CoMMa: Contribution-Aware Medical Multi-Agents From A Game-Theoretic Perspective
items.summary: The paper introduces Contribution-Aware Medical Multi-Agents, a decentralized framework for oncology decision support that leverages heterogeneous patient data.

items.title: FlyAOC: Evaluating Agentic Ontology Curation of Drosophila Scientific Knowledge Bases
items.summary: This research discusses the evaluation of agentic ontology curation in scientific knowledge bases, emphasizing the role of expert curators.

items.title: OpenAI researcher quits over ChatGPT ads, warns of "Facebook" path
items.summary: An OpenAI researcher resigned over concerns that the introduction of ads in ChatGPT could manipulate users, highlighting ethical dilemmas in AI deployment.

items.title: Is a secure AI assistant possible?
items.summary: This article explores the risks associated with AI agents, particularly when they are given tools to interact with the outside world, raising concerns about their behavior.

items.title: GLM-5: From Vibe Coding to Agentic Engineering
items.summary: The Hacker News community is buzzing about GLM-5, which focuses on agentic engineering and complex systems, generating significant engagement.

items.title: Claude Code Is Being Dumbed Down
items.summary: A blog post discusses concerns about the simplification of Claude Code, raising alarms about the potential dumbing down of AI capabilities.
